extension.docketText: ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL as to defendant Stacy Cook - William F. Eustice is appointed to represent the defendant. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (MBB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hartz et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - IT IS ORDERED: The government's motion for detention of Stacy Cook pursuant to the Bail Reform Act is held in abeyance pending the defendant's coming into federal custody. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED: The defendant, Stacy Cook, having received notice of her return to the custody of Nebraska state authorities pending the disposition of this matter and having waived anopportunity for hearing in this matter pursuant to the Interstate Agreement on Detainers, 18 U.S.C. app ยง 9(2), the U.S. Marshal is authorized to return the defendant, Stacy Cook, to the custody of Nebraska state authorities pending the final disposition of this matter and the U.S. Marshal for the District of Nebraska is directed to place a detainer with the correctional officerhaving custody of the defendant as to defendant Stacy Cook. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. - (2 certified copies to the USM) (KBJ)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:07-cr-00187; USA v. Hartz et al;

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED: The defendant, Stacy Cook, having received notice of her return to the custody of Nebraska state authorities pending the disposition of this matter and having waived anopportunity for hearing in this matter pursuant to the Interstate Agreement on Detainers, 18 U.S.C. app ยง 9(2), the U.S. Marshal is authorized to return the defendant, Stacy Cook, to the custody of Nebraska state authorities pending the final disposition of this matter and the U.S. Marshal for the District of Nebraska is directed to place a detainer with the correctional officerhaving custody of the defendant as to defendant Stacy Cook. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. - (2 certified copies to the USM) (KBJ)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hartz et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Stacy Cook (4). The defendant pleaded guilty to count 5 of the indictment and is sentenced to probation for 5 years to be served consecutive to the state court case. Probation will begin at time the defendant is discharged from state custody; $100 special assessment; and $2,487.88 restitution to be paid jointly and severally with Richard Wirth and Jean Long-Wirth. Count 1 of the indictment is dismissed on the motion of the United States as to defendant Stacy Cook only. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. 4 certified copies to the USM. (JSF)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hartz et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Wesla Potts (2). Defendant pleaded guilty to Count 3 of the indictment and is sentenced to 3 years probation; $100 special assessment; and $2,432.61 in restitution which is ordered jointly and severally with Richard Wirth, 8:07cr203, and Jean Long-Wirth, 8:07cr207. Count 1 of the indictment is dismissed on the motion of the United States as to defendant Wesla Potts only. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (4 Certified copies to USM) (JSF)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hartz et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Raymond David Hartz (1). Defendant pleaded guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is sentenced to probation, with special conditions, for a term of 3 years; $100 special assessment; $5,096.75 restitution, ordered jointly and severally with: Richard Wirth 8:07CR203 and Jean Long-Wirth 8:07CR207. Count II of the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this Defendant only. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (4 Certified copies to USM). (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hartz et al
titleInfo.subTitle: AMENDED JUDGMENT for correction of sentence for clerical mistake as to Raymond David Hartz (1). Defendant pleaded guilty to Count II of the Indictment and is sentenced to probation, with special conditions, for a term of 3 years; $100 special assessment; $5,096.75 restitution. Restitution is hereby ordered jointly and severally with: Richard Wirth 8:07CR203&Jean Long-Wirth 8:07CR207. Count I of the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this Defendant only, as to defendant Raymond David Hartz. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (4 Certified copies to USM)(JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hartz et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Joshua Putnam (3), Defendant plead guilty to Count IV of the Indictment and is committed to the Bureau of Prisons for 6 months; 3 years supervised release with special conditions; $100 special assessment; $1,433.30 restitution; Count I of the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the United States Attorney as to this defendant only; restitution is ordered jointly and severally with: Richard Wirth,case number 8:07CR203 and Jean Long-Wirt, case number 8:07CR207 in the amount of $1,433.30. Criminal Case Terminated as to defendant Joshua Putnam. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (4 certified copies to USM)(CJP)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hartz et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Joshua Putnam. A final dispositional hearing will be held before Judge Laurie Smith Camp in Courtroom No. 2, Third Floor, Roman L. Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska, at 1:30 p.m. on November 28, 2011. Defendant must be present in person. Defendant Joshua Putnam is committed to the custody of the Attorney General or his designated representative for confinement in a correctional facility; Defendant shall be afforded a reasonable opportunity for private consultation with defense counsel; and upon order of a United States court or upon request of an attorney for the government, the person in charge of the corrections facility shall deliver defendant to the United States Marshal for the purpose of an appearance in connection with a court proceeding. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (TEL)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:07-cr-00187; USA v. Hartz et al;

Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (TEL)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hartz et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - A final dispositional hearing will be held before Chief Judge Laurie Smith Camp in Courtroom No. 2, Third Floor, Roman L. Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska, at 1:00 p.m. on February 2, 2012. Defendant must be present in person. Upon order of a United States court or upon request of an attorney for the government, the person in charge of the corrections facility shall deliver defendant to the United States Marshal for the purpose of an appearance in connection with a court proceeding as to defendant Joshua Putnam. The November 18, 2011, Order Setting Conditions of Release for Joshua Putnam (Filing No. 159) is revoked. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (AOA)
